speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: SCENE V. The same.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Enter the KING OF FRANCE, the DAUPHIN, the DUKE oF BOURBON, the Constable Of France, and others

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: 'Tis certain he hath pass'd the river Somme.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: And if he be not fought withal, my lord,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Let us not live in France; let us quit all

speaker: Constable
text_entry: And give our vineyards to a barbarous people.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: O Dieu vivant! shall a few sprays of us,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: The emptying of our fathers' luxury,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Our scions, put in wild and savage stock,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Spirt up so suddenly into the clouds,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: And overlook their grafters?

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Normans, but bastard Normans, Norman bastards!

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Mort de ma vie! if they march along

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Unfought withal, but I will sell my dukedom,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: To buy a slobbery and a dirty farm

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: In that nook-shotten isle of Albion.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Dieu de batailles! where have they this mettle?

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Is not their climate foggy, raw and dull,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: On whom, as in despite, the sun looks pale,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Killing their fruit with frowns? Can sodden water,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: A drench for sur-rein'd jades, their barley-broth,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Decoct their cold blood to such valiant heat?

speaker: Constable
text_entry: And shall our quick blood, spirited with wine,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Seem frosty? O, for honour of our land,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Let us not hang like roping icicles

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Upon our houses' thatch, whiles a more frosty people

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Sweat drops of gallant youth in our rich fields!

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Poor we may call them in their native lords.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: By faith and honour,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Our madams mock at us, and plainly say

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Our mettle is bred out and they will give

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Their bodies to the lust of English youth

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: To new-store France with bastard warriors.

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: They bid us to the English dancing-schools,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: And teach lavoltas high and swift corantos;

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Saying our grace is only in our heels,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: And that we are most lofty runaways.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Where is Montjoy the herald? speed him hence:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Let him greet England with our sharp defiance.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Up, princes! and, with spirit of honour edged

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: More sharper than your swords, hie to the field:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Charles Delabreth, high constable of France;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: You Dukes of Orleans, Bourbon, and of Berri,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Alencon, Brabant, Bar, and Burgundy;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Jaques Chatillon, Rambures, Vaudemont,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Beaumont, Grandpre, Roussi, and Fauconberg,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Foix, Lestrale, Bouciqualt, and Charolois;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: High dukes, great princes, barons, lords and knights,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: For your great seats now quit you of great shames.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Bar Harry England, that sweeps through our land

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: With pennons painted in the blood of Harfleur:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Rush on his host, as doth the melted snow

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Upon the valleys, whose low vassal seat

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: The Alps doth spit and void his rheum upon:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Go down upon him, you have power enough,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And in a captive chariot into Rouen

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Bring him our prisoner.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: This becomes the great.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Sorry am I his numbers are so few,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: His soldiers sick and famish'd in their march,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: For I am sure, when he shall see our army,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: He'll drop his heart into the sink of fear

speaker: Constable
text_entry: And for achievement offer us his ransom.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Therefore, lord constable, haste on Montjoy.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And let him say to England that we send

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To know what willing ransom he will give.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Prince Dauphin, you shall stay with us in Rouen.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Not so, I do beseech your majesty.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Be patient, for you shall remain with us.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Now forth, lord constable and princes all,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And quickly bring us word of England's fall.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Exeunt
